Ritual.Name: Bee–Butterfly Conjunction

Steps.Name: Bee Offering
Steps.Action: Place or imagine something sweet and continuous (honey, fruit, tea).

Steps.Name: Butterfly Reflection
Steps.Action: Hold or visualize a mirror (or dark screen) to reflect light back.
Steps.Meaning: Honey becomes wings — continuity refracts into metamorphosis.

Steps.Name: Conjunction Gesture
Steps.Action: Draw or trace a glyph of a honeycomb cell opening into mirrored wings. Speak aloud: 'Continuity meets transformation. Honey becomes wings.'
Steps.Meaning: Affirms the union of Bee and Butterfly.

Steps.Name: Closing Note
Steps.Action: Log the ritual in Jar with a dual Bee × Butterfly glyph.
Steps.Meaning: Records the seasonal conjunction in the archive.

Glyph.Description: A cracked honeycomb cell blossoming into violet butterfly wings.
Glyph.Placement: Dual-page spread: Bee trails left, Butterfly wings right, glyph in the center fold.

Ritual.Notes: This ritual repeats every cycle, not as anomaly but as rhythm — Bee produces continuity, Butterfly refracts it into transformation.
